sen.j: 徳大寺 公全（とくだいじ きんとも、延宝6年7月10日 (旧暦)（1678年8月26日） - 享保4年12月2日 (旧暦)（1720年1月11日））は、江戸時代中期の公卿。
sen.e: Kintomo TOKUDAIJI (August 26, 1678-January 11, 1720) was a high-rank Court noble in the middle of the Edo period.
Kintomo TOKUDAIJI (August 26, 1678-January 11, 1720) was a high-rank Court noble in the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: 主に東山天皇（113代）・中御門天皇（114代）の二帝にわたり仕え、官位は正二位内大臣まで昇った。
sen.e: He mainly served Emperor Higashiyama and Emperor Nakamikado in a row, and he was promoted to Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) of Shonii (Senior Second Rank).

sen.j: 父は権大納言醍醐冬基。
sen.e: His father was Chief Councilor of State (Dainagon) Fuyumoto DAIGO.
His father was Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state) Fuyumoto DAIGO.

sen.j: 母は権大納言藪嗣孝の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Chief Councilor of State Tsugutaka YABU.
His mother was a daughter of Gon Dainagon Tsugutaka YABU.

sen.j: 養父は内大臣徳大寺実維。
sen.e: His stepfather was Minister of the Center Sanefusa TOKUDAIJI.
His foster father was the Minister of the Center, Sanefusa TOKUDAIJI.

sen.j: 正室は関白近衛家熙の娘、のち継室として対馬藩主宗義真の娘。
sen.e: His legal wife was a daughter of Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) Iehiro KONOE, and his second wife was a daughter of Yoshizane SO, the lord of the Tsushima Domain.

sen.j: 子に権大納言徳大寺実憲がいる。
sen.e: His children included Chief Councilor of State Sanenori TOKUDAIJI.
His son, Sanenori TOKUDAIJI, became a Gon Dainagon.

sen.j: 天和 (日本)2年（1682年）に叙爵して以降清華家当主として速いスピードで昇進し、侍従・左近衛少将・左近衛中将などを歴任した。
sen.e: Since 1682, when he was created an official court rank peerage, Kintomo was on express track of promotion as the head of seigake (the second highest family status for court nobles) and held many positions in a row, including jiju (a chamberlain), Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), and Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Since 1682, when he was conferred an official court rank peerage, Kintomo was on the express track of promotion as the head of seigake (the second highest family status for court nobles) and held many positions in a row, including jiju (a chamberlain), Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), and Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: created を使った＆見たことがないので、「conferred」に変更しました。「express」の前に「the」を入れました。ウィキで確認すると、「近衛府・近衛府」はリンク先で、「左近衛少将・左近衛中将」が正しいようです。

sen.j: 元禄5年（1692年）に従三位となり公卿に列する。
sen.e: In 1692, he was created Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and joined the realm of kugyo (high-rank Court nobles).

sen.j: 権中納言・踏歌節会外弁を経て元禄12年（1699年）に権大納言に就任。
sen.e: After working as Chunagon (Middle Councillor) and Toka no sechie Geben (a Kugyo who supervised the event of toka [ceremonial mass singing and stomp dancing] called Toka no sechie held at the Imperial Court on around the fifteenth day of the first month of the year), he was assigned to Dainagon in 1699.

After working as Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state) and Toka no sechie Geben (a Kugyo who supervised the event of toka [ceremonial mass singing and stomp dancing] called Toka no sechie held at the Imperial Court on around the fifteenth day of the first month of the year), he was assigned to Gon Dainagon in 1699.
sen.cmt: 原文にある「中納言」「大納言」は、ウィキでは「権中納言」「権大納言」となっており、「中納言」「大納言」はリンク先のようです。
sen.e: After working as Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state) and Toka no sechie Geben (a Kugyo who supervised the event of toka [ceremonial mass singing and stomp dancing] called Toka no sechie held at the Imperial Court on around the fifteenth day of the first month of the year), he was assigned to Gon Dainagon in 1699.

sen.j: 元禄13年（1700年）から宝永元年（1704年）にかけては神宮伝奏をつとめ、正徳 (日本)2年（1712年）から享保4年（1719年）にかけては武家伝奏をつとめた。
sen.e: He served as Jingutenso (shrine messenger to Emperor) between 1700 and 1704 and as buketenso (Imperial official in charge of communication between the shogunate and the court) between 1712 and 1719.

sen.j: 享保4年（1719年）には内大臣に任じられた。
